document_title: Acute kidney failure: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Acute kidney failure can appear very suddenly and the most common symptoms include:
Reduced abnormal urine output; Fluid retention occurs, causing swelling in the legs, ankles or feet; Chest pain or pressure, difficulty breathing; Fatigue, weakness; Nausea, vomiting; Irregular heartbeat; Seizures or coma in severe cases
Sometimes this condition does not cause any signs and is detected through tests performed for another reason. Some other symptoms include:
Bloody stools; Bad breath; Walk slowly; Whole body swelling; Pain between ribs and hips; Trembling hands; Easy bruising; Mood changes, especially in the elderly; Anorexia; Decreased feeling in your hands or feet; Prolonged bleeding; High blood pressure; There is a metallic taste in the mouth
subsection_title: suy than cap.json. Symptoms of acute kidney failure
